content: crochet an elegant hot pad to set your holiday dishes on this year this beautiful round hot pad is thick yet lacy protecting your table and counters from too-hot dishes these are perfect for christmas gift giving and is sure to be an item that will get lots of ohhs and ahhs at holiday parties *this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience * **difficulty ** intermediate **materials needed ** 5 mm hook or hook needed to obtain gauge 100-120 yards #4 worsted weight cotton yarn ***only use cotton yarn for this project*** yarn needle scissors blocking board optional **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet bphdc = back post half_double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet fptr = front post treble_crochet blo = back loop only space s = space s **additional terms ** picot single_crochet = insert hook yo pull up a loop yo draw through 1 loop 3 times to make a chain 3 then yo and draw through last loop on the hook 3-double_crochet cluster = dc3tog in same stitch small puff st = yo pull up a loop 3 times in same st yo pull through 6 loops yo pull through final 2 loops puff st = yo pull up a loop 4 times in same st yo pull through 8 loops yo pull through final 2 loops **measurements ** finished piece is 9 across excluding loop **gauge ** my circle measured a little over 3 1/4 across after round 6 **additional notes ** -this hotpad is not to be used a an oven mitt or potholder to pick up or remove hot dishes from the oven it is only meant to set hot dishes on after they are done cooking -cotton will scorch at 450 degrees f so if you have been cooking a dish at temperatures hotter than 400 f please wait several minutes for the pot to cool down before setting it on this pot holder -**only** use cotton yarn for this project **never** use acrylic yarn for hot pads because it will melt
